data.title: Fresh Food and a cool little place to eat. Organic, Local
data.text: This place quickly became a favorite at the office.  The fresh baked goods that are made with care.  Thoughtfully prepared farm to table menu items and organic whenever possible.    Rustic brick walls with a mini farmers market island in the middle of the restaurant and very community orientated establishment.   So you walk into this little downtown jewel, and you are immediately relaxed with the soft sound of Gospel music playing in the background. If you are lucky, a local artist may be strumming their guitar and singing a song or two. I would not recommend the place for a meeting the ceilings are so high you can't hear anyone talking that is not sitting right next to you. Back to the food, the Cuban sandwich was the most popular item on the menu with the folks at the office, and we ordered it on a regular basis.  It was so good we rarely strayed from that choice, but when we did the other menu items were always tasty and fresh.  Fresh pasta and bread with local produce made everything pretty delicious. They sale out of the breakfast items pretty fast so don't waste time get there first thing in the morning.

data.title: I have only been once Sooo...
data.text: I wasn't that crazy about it, but, I am told that they have really upped their game. I will try it again when I have time because it supports a very good cause. Give it a try and maybe I'll make time on your review.

data.title: Private Party~ Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: We chose Our Daily Bread Restaurant for our son's Rehearsal Dinner venue. Mendy & Jason Warren (owners) are the most delightful couple! Jason's culinary skills are amazing! Many months ago we sent the soon to be Bride & Groom to Our Daily Bread for dinner so they could "try out the food". My son said it was the best food he had ever eaten! Mendy was so accommodating to their needs and made them feel so special and right at home with a tour of the kitchen from Chef Jason! Both Mendy and Jason were very helpful to us as we developed a menu, decorations, and the flow of the evening. Their support staff were exceptional as well. Our Daily Bread's building is historical, full of Southern charm, elegant and rustic. Our guests continue to rave over the ambiance and the food. We highly recommend Our Daily Bread for your private party and catering needs. Have No Worries~ You will not be disappointed!

data.title: Recommended by locals
data.text: Excellent!!!  On broad in the historic section across from the chamber of commerce and near riverfront!  I had the Mediterranean burger.  My husband had the turkey club.  Very, very good!  They have a Jimmy Carter burger with peanut butter!  :)

data.title: Restaurant that has improved, great food
data.text: I reviewed this restaurant this time last year and the review was not that great.  Since that time, I am happy to say that Our Daily Bread has really improved.  Service was wonderful and friendly.  The food was excellent - grilled pimento cheese and fries were wonderful.  My mother had a burger and said it was excellent as well!  The only thing I wish was a little different is that they had Coke products instead of Pepsi.

data.title: Poor Service
data.text: We had lunch at OUR DAILY BREAD on 5/28/2015.  There were not enough servers or menus to handle the people who came in.  I had the Cuban sandwich....the worst ever.  The pork was not good, but the real downer was the tasteless bread.  The fries were not hot and we had to search for a waiter to get water.  I won't go again.

data.title: Best Burger Resturant in Albany Georgia
data.text:
Located in a wonderful building with great decor. The wait staff are nice and knowlegable about the menu.   Willing to go the extra mile.
Lots of options for people with food allergies.
French fries have a nice parm, herb blend on them. You have got to try them.  There are more than burgers on the menu. But the burger is thick, real meat and so many options for you to put on your burger.  Burger heaven.

data.title: Healthy or Decadent - Your Choice
data.text:
Our grandson was being treated to an early graduation dinner and he chose Our Daily Bread because of the Krispy Kreme burger. Yes, a burger in a Krispy Kreme donut! They recently moved into new digs and its charming! The service was fast and friendly.

The appetizers were good - mozzarella sticks and pimento cheese dip with homemade pita chips.

I had the Muenster Grilled Cheese and my husband had the Philly Cheesesteak. The Krispy Kreme burger was devoured by the teenager. The one healthy entree at our table was butternut squash with grilled veggies. 

The food was great and the chef came out to check on us to make sure we were happy. Courtney, our server, was a delight!

Thumbs up all around.

data.title: Scruffy
data.text: For a Church group fund raiser restaurant is a tribute, but the place is a dump and very scruffy with worn out table, chairs etc, so it looks unclean and makes one nervous about eating their food, plus they do not serve any beer or wine, but saw others bringing their own wine and beer in with them. so we didn't stay and went elsewhere to eat.

data.title: Regular luncheon place.
data.text: I enjoy eating here regularly.   The menu is somewhat limited and it would be nice to expand, but I love the Cuban and Turkey sandwiches with roasted potatoes.

data.title: Just hamburgers
data.text: This place doesn't really make a 100% sense whenever you really look at it. Its just a hamburger joint. Their name would think of something a little more down to earth, but its all up in the clouds. I don't get, really. A little over priced, some of the food is good, wait staff is all questionable, and its just weird

data.title: Great Sandwichs
data.text: A great place for lunch downtown. The Cuban and The Philly Cheese stake are both great. Service is friendly and the atmosphere is great. A hidden gem in downtown Albany

data.title: Quiet place for good food
data.text: Solo lunch while on business. Saw this restaurant while driving by so I thought I would check it out.  Simple menu soups salads sandwiches and burgers.  You can get beef fed or organic burger options for a couple of dollars more.  Disappointed the burgers were precooked and a little overcooked. It has bakery items which I did not sample but looked good.  Service was a little slow as business began to pick up during lunch. Overall a good experience. I would try it again and order one of their sandwiches.

data.title: Great idea of a restaurant, needs a little work
data.text:
I love the idea that this is a Christian establishment.  The restaurant is an asset to downtown Albany.  The menu is simple but complete.  However, the idea of hiring family members to be servers instead of quality adults to do so might be a mistake.  When I asked "Can you tell me what is in the chicken salad?" The response was, "Ummmm, I have no idea!  I know nothing about cooking.  Chicken, I guess?"  Not exactly the answer I was looking for.  I would have been happy with an "I'm not exactly sure, let me go ask someone who would know."  
All of the people at our table ordered a burger of some sort.  They all arrived quickly and were great tasting and cooked to order.  Prices were reasonable.  Will return but hope staff would be a little bit better trained.

data.title: Won't go back
data.text: Everytime I go there the good is burnt. No matter what I order it isn't cooked well. The server had no idea what she was doing. I just can't eat there again. Very disappointing.

data.title: Awesome local place
data.text: We had a business lunch and our food and service was absolutely wonderful.. The decor is quaint and the menu was fresh and had plenty of choices. Definitely recommend this place ..two thumbs up!!!!

data.title: Gotta try this....
data.text: If you are looking for a place to eat where your food is fresh to order, entrees and sides are made with such art and the desserts are oh so tasty and fresh.....well Our Daily Bread is the place to be. The owners work hard and they make you a part of their family by visiting your table when they have time. The staff is great and they do live music on Friday's. If ou live or visit Albany GA .....its definitely a place to eat a unique burger...

data.title: Great little place in Albany
data.text: Great food tucked away in downtown Albany. The hamburgers are super great! Try the pasta as a side and get a slice of cake. :) The sweet tea is wonderful too. Friendly faces and great food.

data.title: Great fresh food!
data.text: Food was excellent.  Son tried Krispy Kreme burger and absolutely loved it.  Wait staff was great.  Very relaxing atmosphere with great decor.  Can even order your burger with grassfed beef bought locally !

data.title: Delicious Lunch and Great Service!
data.text: My husband and I stopped here for lunch on a Saturday when we were in Albany for a soccer tournament. He had the Krispy Kreme burger and I had the turkey BLT. We both got roasted potatoes with our sandwiches. The food was delicious and the potatoes were more like french fries, which we loved. The turkey on my sandwich was real, sliced turkey and not processed. We had the red velvet cake for dessert and it was fabulous! The server was very friendly and attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch. We would definitely return and would encourage others to try Our Daily Bread.
